{ "step_by_step_thinking": "Cardiolipin is indeed found in the inner mitochondrial membrane, so option A is true. It also plays a role in the process of apoptosis, making option B true. Cardiolipin is also known as diphosphatidyl glycerol, so option C is true. However, cardiolipin does not have a choline base with a labile methyl group. Instead, it has a glycerol backbone and four fatty acid chains, making option D false.", "answer_choice": "D" }
